posts.message:
It's maybe considered a silly question, but I'm really dizzy about it..
how it works? I mean the access token.
i.e WordPress authentication goes this way:
$credentials = array(
  'username': 'boo',
  'password': 'foo',
);
wp_signon($credentials, false);
It's the concept of user and password.. so I only use the api to retriever the email address then sign him/her using only email address..
is it nasty this way?? if so, how should it be then??
I appreciate any help thanks.

posts.message:
I open a lot of tabs on firefox, and I mean A LOT! I was searching for addons to help me close tabs as fast as I open them so that I would keep the rate of open tabs steady. The best I found was something that closed duplicate tabs.

I usually have a lot of tabs from the same domain name open most of the time when I am researching something, or even when I am surfing facebook. So I thought it would be cool if I could close tabs belonging to a specific domain name, and not just duplicate.

I didn't find it, so I created it :)

Pretty basic, no optimization whatsoever, but here it is.
posts.caption: github.com
posts.description: firefox-power-close - A firefox addon to close all tabs based on domain name.
